meaningMnemonic:
You <kanji>examine</kanji> it but you also <kanji>chastise</kanji> it, because you want to make sure this examining is correct. This is <vocabulary>to examine</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to study</vocabulary>. All require chastising things to be sure for sure.

検討する generally implies thoroughly examining something <vocabulary>to consider</vocabulary> its pros and cons, suitability, or viability.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
